member.name: M:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.DocumentsResource.AnalyzeEntities(Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnalyzeEntitiesRequest)

member.summary: Finds named entities (currently proper names and common nouns) in the text along with entity types, salience, mentions for each entity, and other properties.

member.summary: The encoding type used by the API to calculate offsets.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnalyzeEntitiesResponse.Entities
member.summary: The recognized entities in the input document.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnalyzeEntitiesResponse.Language
member.summary: The language of the text, which will be the same as the language specified in the request or, if not specified, the automatically-detected language. See Document.language field for more details.

member.summary: The entity-level sentiment analysis request message.

member.summary: The entity-level sentiment analysis response message.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnalyzeEntitySentimentResponse.Entities
member.summary: The recognized entities in the input document with associated sentiments.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnalyzeEntitySentimentResponse.Language
member.summary: The language of the text, which will be the same as the language specified in the request or, if not specified, the automatically-detected language. See Document.language field for more details.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnalyzeSentimentRequest.EncodingType
member.summary: The encoding type used by the API to calculate sentence offsets.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnalyzeSentimentResponse.DocumentSentiment
member.summary: The overall sentiment of the input document.

member.summary: The language of the text, which will be the same as the language specified in the request or, if not specified, the automatically-detected language. See Document.language field for more details.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnalyzeSentimentResponse.Sentences
member.summary: The sentiment for all the sentences in the document.

member.summary: The encoding type used by the API to calculate offsets.

member.summary: The language of the text, which will be the same as the language specified in the request or, if not specified, the automatically-detected language. See Document.language field for more details.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnalyzeSyntaxResponse.Tokens
member.summary: Tokens, along with their syntactic information, in the input document.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnnotateTextRequest
member.summary: The request message for the text annotation API, which can perform multiple analysis types (sentiment, entities, and syntax) in one call.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnnotateTextRequest.EncodingType
member.summary: The encoding type used by the API to calculate offsets.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnnotateTextResponse.Categories
member.summary: Categories identified in the input document.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnnotateTextResponse.DocumentSentiment
member.summary: The overall sentiment for the document. Populated if the user enables AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_document_sentiment.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnnotateTextResponse.Entities
member.summary: Entities, along with their semantic information, in the input document. Populated if the user enables AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_entities.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnnotateTextResponse.Language
member.summary: The language of the text, which will be the same as the language specified in the request or, if not specified, the automatically-detected language. See Document.language field for more details.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnnotateTextResponse.Sentences
member.summary: Sentences in the input document. Populated if the user enables AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_syntax.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.AnnotateTextResponse.Tokens
member.summary: Tokens, along with their syntactic information, in the input document. Populated if the user enables AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_syntax.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.ClassificationCategory
member.summary: Represents a category returned from the text classifier.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.ClassificationCategory.Confidence
member.summary: The classifier's confidence of the category. Number represents how certain the classifier is that this category represents the given text.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.ClassificationCategory.Name
member.summary: The name of the category representing the document, from the [predefined taxonomy](/natural- language/docs/categories).

member.name: T:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.DependencyEdge
member.summary: Represents dependency parse tree information for a token. (For more information on dependency labels, see http://www.aclweb.org/anthology/P13-2017

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.DependencyEdge.HeadTokenIndex
member.summary: Represents the head of this token in the dependency tree. This is the index of the token which has an arc going to this token. The index is the position of the token in the array of tokens returned by the API method. If this token is a root token, then the `head_token_index` is its own index.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.DependencyEdge.Label
member.summary: The parse label for the token.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Document.Content
member.summary: The content of the input in string format. Cloud audit logging exempt since it is based on user data.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Document.GcsContentUri
member.summary: The Google Cloud Storage URI where the file content is located. This URI must be of the form: gs://bucket_name/object_name. For more details, see https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/reference-uris. NOTE: Cloud Storage object versioning is not supported.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Document.Language
member.summary: The language of the document (if not specified, the language is automatically detected). Both ISO and BCP-47 language codes are accepted. [Language Support](/natural-language/docs/languages) lists currently supported languages for each API method. If the language (either specified by the caller or automatically detected) is not supported by the called API method, an `INVALID_ARGUMENT` error is returned.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Document.Type
member.summary: Required. If the type is not set or is `TYPE_UNSPECIFIED`, returns an `INVALID_ARGUMENT` error.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Entity
member.summary: Represents a phrase in the text that is a known entity, such as a person, an organization, or location. The API associates information, such as salience and mentions, with entities.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Entity.Mentions
member.summary: The mentions of this entity in the input document. The API currently supports proper noun mentions.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Entity.Metadata
member.summary:
Metadata associated with the entity.
Currently, Wikipedia URLs and Knowledge Graph MIDs are provided, if available. The associated keys are "wikipedia_url" and "mid", respectively.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Entity.Name
member.summary: The representative name for the entity.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Entity.Salience
member.summary:
The salience score associated with the entity in the [0, 1.0] range.
The salience score for an entity provides information about the importance or centrality of that entity to the entire document text. Scores closer to 0 are less salient, while scores closer to 1.0 are highly salient.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Entity.Sentiment
member.summary: For calls to AnalyzeEntitySentiment or if AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_entity_sentiment is set to true, this field will contain the aggregate sentiment expressed for this entity in the provided document.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.EntityMention
member.summary: Represents a mention for an entity in the text. Currently, proper noun mentions are supported.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.EntityMention.Sentiment
member.summary: For calls to AnalyzeEntitySentiment or if AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_entity_sentiment is set to true, this field will contain the sentiment expressed for this mention of the entity in the provided document.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.EntityMention.Type
member.summary: The type of the entity mention.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Features
member.summary: All available features for sentiment, syntax, and semantic analysis. Setting each one to true will enable that specific analysis for the input.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Features.ClassifyText
member.summary: Classify the full document into categories.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Features.ExtractEntitySentiment
member.summary: Extract entities and their associated sentiment.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.PartOfSpeech
member.summary: Represents part of speech information for a token. Parts of speech are as defined in http://www.lrec- conf.org/proceedings/lrec2012/pdf/274_Paper.pdf

member.name: T:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Sentence
member.summary: Represents a sentence in the input document.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Sentence.Sentiment
member.summary: For calls to AnalyzeSentiment or if AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_document_sentiment is set to true, this field will contain the sentiment for the sentence.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Sentiment
member.summary: Represents the feeling associated with the entire text or entities in the text.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Sentiment.Magnitude
member.summary: A non-negative number in the [0, +inf) range, which represents the absolute magnitude of sentiment regardless of score (positive or negative).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Sentiment.Score
member.summary: Sentiment score between -1.0 (negative sentiment) and 1.0 (positive sentiment).

member.name: T:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Status
member.summary:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). The error model is designed to be:
- Simple to use and understand for most users - Flexible enough to meet unexpected needs
# Overview
The `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details. The error code should be an enum value of google.rpc.Code, but it may accept additional error codes if needed. The error message should be a developer-facing English message that helps developers *understand* and *resolve* the error. If a localized user-facing error message is needed, put the localized message in the error details or localize it in the client. The optional error details may contain arbitrary information about the error. There is a predefined set of error detail types in the package `google.rpc` that can be used for common error conditions.
# Language mapping
The `Status` message is the logical representation of the error model, but it is not necessarily the actual wire format. When the `Status` message is exposed in different client libraries and different wire protocols, it can be mapped differently. For example, it will likely be mapped to some exceptions in Java, but more likely mapped to some error codes in C.
# Other uses
The error model and the `Status` message can be used in a variety of environments, either with or without APIs, to provide a consistent developer experience across different environments.
Example uses of this error model include:
- Partial errors. If a service needs to return partial errors to the client, it may embed the `Status` in the normal response to indicate the partial errors.
- Workflow errors. A typical workflow has multiple steps. Each step may have a `Status` message for error reporting.
- Batch operations. If a client uses batch request and batch response, the `Status` message should be used directly inside batch response, one for each error sub-response.
- Asynchronous operations. If an API call embeds asynchronous operation results in its response, the status of those operations should be represented directly using the `Status` message.
- Logging. If some API errors are stored in logs, the message `Status` could be used directly after any stripping needed for security/privacy reasons.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Status.Code
member.summary: The status code, which should be an enum value of google.rpc.Code.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Status.Details
member.summary: A list of messages that carry the error details. There is a common set of message types for APIs to use.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Status.Message
member.summary: A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the google.rpc.Status.details field, or localized by the client.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.TextSpan
member.summary: Represents an output piece of text.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.TextSpan.BeginOffset
member.summary: The API calculates the beginning offset of the content in the original document according to the EncodingType specified in the API request.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.TextSpan.Content
member.summary: The content of the output text.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Token
member.summary: Represents the smallest syntactic building block of the text.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Token.DependencyEdge
member.summary: Dependency tree parse for this token.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.CloudNaturalLanguage.v1.Data.Token.PartOfSpeech
member.summary: Parts of speech tag for this token.
